25 reviews in English
Review from Lakshmi R.
38 friends 41 reviews
Lakshmi R.
San Jose, CA 6/15/2012 Cheap Gas and Clean Bathrooms. When on the road, you crave to find a bathroom that will not leave you feeling that youv'e contracted Hep C and Lost Hills is not only Hep C free, but also a great stop on the way from Southern California to Northern California.
I know I've done the review under Loves and although Love's does have cheap gas, I'm going to make a general note about the options you get at this rest stop. You can find a lot of eating options and what was interesting is that Taco Bell had a new menu that rolled out and Lost Hills was one of the first to feature the items. If you are driving on i5, then this definitely should be a scheduled stop until you head on *if you require facilities*.
Listed in: Clean Restroom Alert! Northern…
Was this review…?
Useful Funny Cool
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from Janel P.
2 friends 6 reviews
Janel P.
Hayward, CA 6/26/2012 Despite the reasonable gas prices and great variety of food choices, the customer service rep at the main counter simply doesn't care if you ever come back. I took up a bottled water, can of beer and chips to the counter and the rep asks me if I need a bag; my environmentally friendly response was "no thanks". The rep immediately says: " do you want to get a ticket ? " I don't know if its illegal to drink the beer that you bought on the premises, even though its a restaurant environment. I guess these reps are just too unhappy about their job and disgruntled about their company. But, definitely wouldn't recommend anyone whose expecting any friendly smiles to stop by here......
Was this review…?
Useful Funny Cool
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from Angie C.
Elite '12 21 friends 120 reviews
Angie C.
Mountain View, CA 7/4/2012 I love this place. Every time I drive to LA, I stop here to top off. The gas prices are reasonable and there's a great cold drink/coffee/snack selection. I've never encountered someone unfriendly. The only problem I've ever had was there being long bathroom lines or long lines at the pump if I managed to poorly time my trip and get stuck in Lost Hills with every traveler on the road.
Was this review…?
Useful (1) Funny Cool (1)

Review from Christine S.
Elite '12 339 friends 232 reviews
Christine S.
Fremont, CA 12/28/2011 I always stop here when I'm on Highway 5. ALWAYS.
Cheapest gas in the middle of no where, clean bathrooms (and many many many stalls, complete with sales ads on the doors), and they sell lotto. I am definitely a huge fan of this place. It even has an adjoining Arby's!
Was this review…?

Review from Rob I.
3 friends 45 reviews
Rob I.
Morgan Hill, CA 1/10/2012 Almost always has the best prices across a major portion of highway 5. I always get in and out quickly, there's usually no wait for the bathrooms, though I usually hit this stop later in the evening. Store prices are decent. I'm giving 5 stars primarily for their consistently low gas prices.
BTW, I have stopped here at least 5 times per year for a few years.
Was this review…?

Review from Maggie M.
Elite '12 36 friends 138 reviews
Maggie M.
Long Beach, CA 10/31/2011 1 Check-in Here WOW I have never purchased gas that was so cheap and long lasting! You get more than what you pay for. The bathrooms are really clean and I didn't feel as though I had to put a bunch of seat covers to use their toilets... haha I wish they brought Love's down to the LA area as I would prefer their gas versus Chevron or Shell or maybe even Costco.

Subrosa I.
Palo Alto, CA 3/19/2012 1 Check-in Here This is a nice pit stop. The prices are lower than other gas stations along Highway 5. The restrooms are clean. And the convenience store is well-stocked.

Elite '12 568 friends 517 reviews
Vb L.
San Mateo, CA 1/11/2012 1 Check-in Here Cheap gas. Fast in and out. Clean washrooms. Knocked off a star because they had no lemonade. I'll be back on the next trek to LA, but this time I bring my own lemonade.

Review from B J M.
4 friends 14 reviews
B J M.
Los Angeles, CA 3/28/2012 Love's is an essential gas up and rest stop on the way from L.A. to points north. And the connected Arby's has great fries and tasty snack foods to consume with that pent-up highway energy,

Review from Michael W.
3428 friends 1622 reviews
Michael W.
La Verne, CA 4/17/2011 1 photo Even though I have never seen it the movie the Road makes me think of route 5 to Nor Cal.
Anyways......about the gas station.
Theres like 5/6 pumps here total
Some person decided to leave their car at the pump (or got stabbed going to the bathroom) and EVERYONE was waiting for them to come back.
It took the store over a hour just to ask the person to come to their car.
FAIL. (Please no hate mail Lost Hills yelpers)
On the plus side I did have subway so I can scratch that off my bookmark list of must try yelp places!
Listed in: Camberia/San Simeon
Was this review…?
Useful (6) Funny (5) Cool (6)
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from Eric N.
Elite '12 1211 friends 467 reviews
Eric N.
Anaheim, CA 2/2/2011 1 photo 1 Check-in Here Cheap gas, warm store, clean restrooms...as good as it gets. At least in the middle of nowhere.
I spend a whole lot of time driving up and down the 5 freeway between NorCal and Los Angeles. One of the pitfalls of that drive is the sparse nature of the businesses that line the route. You are lucky to find a gas station and restaurant every 30 or 40 miles. It is really hit or miss on the price of gas...it will either be cheaper than the big cities or 20 percent more expensive...it just all depends on the exit you take.
That is why I love stopping here at this Love's. They have gas that is among the lowest price on the whole drive and the whole location itself is a pleasure to use. When it was freezing outside the store itself was nice and toasty warm. Last time I stopped here it was 2am and the person working inside the store greeted me with an enthusiastic "Good morning!". The restrooms are wayyyy better than stopping at a nasty public rest stop...they keep them up very well. There is an Arby's inside the store and a Jack in the Box right next door so not only can you get gas on the cheap but you can also get some food for your journey.
I highly recommend this as a stop on your drive up or down the 5 freeway. It is nice to find something so nice while out and about on a long...boring drive.
:0)
Listed in: Zoom zoom zoom... , LA to the Bay
Was this review…?
Useful (22) Funny (14) Cool (15)
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review

Sean B.
San Jose, CA 11/1/2011 1 Check-in Here The gas is cheap. The parking lot is huge. But the truck drivers here smell of stale sweat, methamphetamine, and rage.

Review from Maureen G.
Elite '12 713 friends 623 reviews
Maureen G.
Stockton, CA 8/20/2011 It's important to have go to places to stop, stretch your legs, potty and get some refreshments! Stockton to LA is a haul and not one I enjoy much but it's nice to know there are a few oasis like places along the way. Clean, friendly with lots of refreshment choices.
Listed in: Road Trip
Was this review…?

Review from justin o.
18 friends 80 reviews
justin o.
Long Beach, CA 3/29/2007 1 photo Driving the I-5 isn't so bad when you know you gotta little bit of LOVE waiting for you along the way. Love's travel stop in Lost Hills (?) is one of three in California so if you're in the neighborhood, correction - the middle of nowhere, stop by.
Their "country store" has a vast selection of gizmos and gadgets, most of which are useless to any civilized individual, but the fun factor is definitely a 10 out of 10. I think my last purchase was "The Terror" on DVD for $5 - worth it? Not really. But it was fun!
My only complaint is that they got rid of their old style Love's coffee mugs, which were practically spill proof. I've never seen another mug like it and I lost the top to mine - damn!
Check them out... they're all over the country too.
Was this review…?
Useful (2) Funny (1) Cool (1)
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from shelby s.
Elite '12 35 friends 122 reviews
shelby s.
Sacramento, CA 7/1/2011 I road trip to where I grew up in LA 5 or 6 times a year and I know its time to stop and stretch my legs or get gas if I see that heart in the distance. The gas here is cheap in comparison to everywhere else along the 5. The store has a ridiculous amount of crap that is fun to look like while you're waiting for your pal to come out of the loo. Straw cowboy hat? Van Halen cd? Plus they always play country music which goes along with the ambiance of being in the middle of nowhere. Clean restroom too... Nice that there is more than one stall for those busy holiday weekends.
Was this review…?
Useful (1) Funny Cool
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from Timothy O.
140 friends 573 reviews
Timothy O.
Fresno, CA 7/20/2006 This is a truck stop on I-5 where it meets California Route 46 in Lost Hills. There's a gas station, a large mini-mart, clean restrooms, and an Arby's fast food restaurant in the same complex. It's a good place for a pit stop on I-5 near Bakersfield.
Love's in a chain based out of Oklahoma, so they're mostly located in the South. They seem to cater to the RV and trucker crowd, so I can see more Californians buying the novelties for their kitsch factor instead of out of a true affinity for Larry the Cable Guy.
Listed in: My Most Useful Reviews
Was this review…?
Useful Funny Cool (1)
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from Patrick A.
75 friends 125 reviews
Patrick A.
San Lorenzo, CA 9/11/2010 I LOVES this place!
They have everything you would need on a road trip, plus some things you don't need but end up buying anyway. The gas is usually a little cheaper here compared to the surrounding stations, and always a lot cheaper when compared to other stops on i-5. Its always great to stop here, and a comfort that after driving for hours seeing a huge loves sign up in the air.
Plus, a love's lighter is only like 70 cents!

Cupertino, CA 7/27/2011 Cheapest gas you can get on all of I-5. Costco prices. We never go anywhere else for gas!

Berkeley, CA 8/28/2011 2 Check-ins Here as cheap as the Arco across the street with cleaner bathrooms. More options for food and snacks. THE CHEAPEST GAS ON I-5!!

Review from Angelo B.
26 friends 74 reviews
Angelo B.
Cerritos, CA 1/29/2011 This is my go to place for gas on my LA-SF roadtrips.
-Clean restrooms -Good gas prices -Plenty of grassy areas for my dogs to stretch their legs and do their business -Lots of fast food options near by

Review from Naeem H.
1 friend 7 reviews
Naeem H.
Pasadena, CA 8/3/2010 I used to love coming to this stop for gas and a restroom break. They usually have pretty cheap gas and clean restrooms. They also have good deals on drinks and snacks.
However, the last two times I came here, they ring up the wrong price on deals. This last time I went I bought 2 cokes (where the price tag said 2 for 2.22), but they rung it up as 3 something. I know it's a dollar, but they should have given me the correct price. I told them that the price tag said a certain price, and they responded that it was tax, but I know CRV is only 5 cents per bottle. They didn't even go check the price themselves when I told them, and they were very adamant they were correct. I was pretty pissed at that point, but then one of the clerks pulled out a dollar and said "here you go" very rudely. At that point I was fuming and just left.
So for restrooms and gas I would give them four stars, but for tricking customers and being impolite employees, I give them 2 stars.
Was this review…?
Useful Funny Cool

Denny V.
Cerritos, CA 6/25/2010 Everytime heading up to Santa Cruz or just North we stop here. Pretty litted place and cheap gas stations. Decent amount of restaurants. Middle of no where. But good place to stop. and we stop by to get gas here because the station was called LOVE. awesome huh? haha..
